intro: Herissantia, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers that resemble butterflies, hence its common name. The plants typically have opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves and are native to tropical regions of Africa and Madagascar. Herissantia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. They prefer warm, humid climates and well-drained soil for optimal growth.
